definition: to send/to mail/to entrust/to depend on/to attach oneself to/to live (in a house)/to lodge/foster (son etc)
thick/deep or profound/kind/generous/rich or strong in flavor/to favor/to stress
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]

sentences.english: Liao Minhui had aspirations for his daughter.
sentences.chinese: 廖民辉对他的女儿寄予厚望。

sentences.english: In fairness, you probably haven't got high hopes for this year's movie adaptation of The Smurfs.
sentences.chinese: 公平地说，你可能不会对改编的电影蓝精灵寄予厚望。

sentences.english: The American government attached great importance to this mission and placed high hope on Parker.
sentences.chinese: 美国政府非常重视此次修约之事，对伯驾寄予厚望。

sentences.english: Apple is pinning big hopes on its new store in Covent Garden. Photograph: Jonathan Hordle/Rex Features
sentences.chinese: 苹果公司对考文特花园新店寄予厚望。

sentences.english: He also has great hope for the country's solar energy potential.
sentences.chinese: 他同时对国家的太阳能潜力寄予厚望。

sentences.english: The company also has high hopes for an upcoming sedan called G6.
sentences.chinese: 比亚迪还对即将推出的轿车G6寄予厚望。

sentences.english: Now people desire to eradictate MRD by immunotherapy after chemotherapy.
sentences.chinese: 正因为如此人们对免疫治疗寄予厚望。

definition: to lock one's door and refuse to see sb
to regard sth as valuable/to think highly of (a younger person, a subordinate etc)
to have a preference for/to fancy/to choose after consideration/to settle on
to put in an important position
to regard as having good prospects
